title: Function Concepts - Graphical and Analytical: Rational

content.description:
The graph has a dotted vertical line that passes through x equals 2. A portion of the curve is asymptotic to the vertical line.

Moving from left to right:

The curve begins at a point to the right of the dotted vertical line with approximate coordinates (2.1 comma negative 10.5).

The curve trends gradually up to the right and passes through the following points with approximate coordinates:

(2.5 comma negative 2)

(3 comma 0)

(4 comma 1.5)

(5 comma 2.4)

(6 comma 3)

(7 comma 3.5)

(8 comma 3.9)

(9 comma 4.2)

(10 comma 4.5)

The curve ends at the point with approximate coordinates (10.5 comma 4.6).

The figure shows the graph of the increasing function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> on its domain of all real numbers <math alttext="x greater than 2"><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>2</mn></math>. The points <math alttext="open parentheses 3 comma 0 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="open parentheses 6 comma 3 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> are on the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>. The function <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator 9 over denominator open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses end fraction"> <mi>g</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>9</mn> <mfenced> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>-</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mfenced> </mfrac> </math>.
content.question:
Part A

(i) The function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is defined by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses g ring operator f close parentheses open parentheses x close parentheses equals g open parentheses f open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>∘</mo><mi>f</mi></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. Find the value of <math alttext="h open parentheses 6 close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mn>6</mn></mfenced></math> as a decimal approximation, or indicate that it is not defined. Show the work that leads to your answer.

(ii) Find all real zeros of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>, or indicate there are no real zeros.

frqParts.text:
Part A

(i) The function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is defined by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses g ring operator f close parentheses open parentheses x close parentheses equals g open parentheses f open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>∘</mo><mi>f</mi></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. Find the value of <math alttext="h open parentheses 6 close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mn>6</mn></mfenced></math> as a decimal approximation, or indicate that it is not defined. Show the work that leads to your answer.

(ii) Find all real zeros of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>, or indicate there are no real zeros.

Part B

(i) Find all values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>, as decimal approximations, for which <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals negative 5.8"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>5.8</mn></math>, or indicate that there are no such values.

(ii) Determine the end behavior of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> as <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> decreases without bound. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit.

Part C

(i) Is the function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> invertible?

(ii) Give a reason for your answer in part C(i) based on properties of the function \(f\). Refer to points on the graph of \(f\) in your reasoning.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
